source: 211 Arizona (211arizona.org) and Arizona Department of Veterans Services

resources.name: 2-1-1 Arizona Information and Referral Service
resources.description: Free, confidential helpline connecting veterans to community resources including housing, employment, food, legal aid, mental health services, and benefits assistance. Live operators available in English and Spanish.

resources.name: Be Connected
resources.description: Statewide initiative connecting service members, veterans and their families to support and resources. Operates Monday-Friday 8 AM-5 PM MST. Serves all service members regardless of branch, component, length/era of service, and discharge status.

resources.name: MANA House
resources.description: 76-bed transitional housing facility for homeless and formerly homeless veterans. Provides housing, three meals a day, clothing, personal items, job placement, case management, and other services 365 days per year.

resources.name: Housing for Heroes
resources.address: Serves Maricopa, Yuma, and Pinal Counties
resources.description: Veteran-centered housing support program designed to assist veterans and their families experiencing homelessness or at risk of losing housing. Funded through VA's Supportive Services for Veteran Families (SSVF) program.

resources.name: U.S.VETS Phoenix
resources.description: Has served more than 10,000 veterans since 2001. Provides transitional and permanent housing, mental health services, career development, case management, and supports over 300 veterans experiencing homelessness.

resources.name: Arizona OIC (Opportunities Industrialization Center) - Sullivan's Place
resources.description: Provides dignified housing and supportive services to assist veterans and their families in attaining self-sufficiency. Includes housing for single males, single females, and families.

resources.name: Arizona State Veteran Home - Phoenix
resources.description: Skilled nursing and long-term care facility for Arizona veterans. One of four state veteran homes providing residential care.

resources.name: Arizona State Veteran Home - Tucson
resources.description: Skilled nursing and long-term care facility for Arizona veterans. Admission coordinator available at listed phone number.

resources.name: Arizona State Veteran Home - Flagstaff
resources.description: Skilled nursing and long-term care facility for Arizona veterans. Admission coordinator available at listed phone number.

resources.name: Arizona State Veteran Home - Yuma
resources.description: Skilled nursing and long-term care facility for Arizona veterans. Admissions hotline available. (Note: Facility and website under final construction)

resources.name: VA Phoenix Health Care System
resources.address: 650 East Indian School Road, Phoenix, AZ 85012-1839
resources.description: Comprehensive VA healthcare system providing mental health services, homeless veteran care, behavioral health programs, and inpatient/outpatient services including telehealth.

resources.name: VA Community Resource and Referral Center (CRRC) - Phoenix
resources.address: 1500 East Thomas Road, Suite 106, Phoenix, AZ 85014-5748
resources.description: One-stop access center for homeless and at-risk veterans. Provides community-based multiagency services to promote permanent housing, health and mental health care, career development, and access to benefits.

resources.name: Phoenix Vet Center
resources.description: Free, confidential counseling for veterans, service members, and families at no cost in a non-medical setting. Focuses on mental health, PTSD, depression, and military sexual trauma.

resources.name: Tucson Vet Center
resources.description: Free, confidential counseling for veterans, service members, and families. Provides mental health services and PTSD counseling at no cost.

resources.name: Prescott Vet Center
resources.description: Free, confidential counseling for veterans, service members, and families. Provides mental health services and PTSD counseling.

resources.name: Mesa Vet Center
resources.description: Free, confidential counseling for veterans, service members, and families. Provides mental health services.

resources.name: Peoria Vet Center
resources.description: Free, confidential counseling for veterans, service members, and families. Provides mental health services.

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7, confidential crisis support for veterans and their loved ones. Private, free service available via phone, chat, or text.

resources.name: Southern Arizona Legal Aid - Veterans Hope & Justice Project
resources.description: Legal services for homeless or at-risk veterans. Provides assistance with consumer protection, family law, housing, public benefits, VA benefits, and restorative justice.

resources.name: Arizona Department of Veterans' Services - Veteran Benefits Counselors
resources.description: Accredited veteran benefits counselors providing free information and assistance regarding federal and state benefits. Operates remotely across Arizona and at state veteran homes.

resources.name: Arizona Disabled Veteran Foundation
resources.description: 501(c)(3) organization providing emergency financial assistance to Arizona disabled and non-disabled veterans, National Guardsmen, and Reservists. Assists with rent, utilities, food, medical needs, legal aid, and more.

resources.name: Catholic Charities Arizona - Veteran Services
resources.description: Provides emergency, transitional, and permanent housing plus case management and connections to MANA House and regional programs for veterans in Maricopa, Coconino, Mohave, and Yavapai Counties.

resources.name: The Salvation Army - Phoenix Veteran Services
resources.address: 2707 E. Van Buren St, Phoenix, AZ 85008
resources.description: Provides case management, homeless comfort kits with clothing and food, hygiene items, resume writing, job search assistance, emotional and spiritual support, and rent/utilities assistance.

resources.name: Arizona AHCCCS - Mental Health Resources
resources.description: Arizona healthcare program providing mental health resources and advocacy for service members and veterans through healthcare system coordination.

resources.name: Arizona Department of Economic Security - Veterans Employment Services
resources.description: Provides employment services, job training, career counseling, and SNAP assistance for veterans. JVSG program offers individualized services with priority job referrals.

resources.name: American Legion - Phoenix Regional Office
resources.description: Veterans service organization at Phoenix VA Regional Office providing advocacy and support services to veterans.

resources.name: Disabled American Veterans - Phoenix Regional Office
resources.description: Veterans service organization providing advocacy and support for disabled veterans.

resources.name: Veterans of Foreign Wars (VFW) - Arizona
resources.description: Veterans service organization providing advocacy, community support, and benefits assistance to veterans.

resources.name: Vietnam Veterans of America - Arizona
resources.description: Veterans service organization focused on Vietnam-era veterans advocacy and support.

resources.name: Arizona Food Bank Network - Military Hunger Program
resources.description: Food bank network with directory of local food pantries available to veterans. Maintains resource database for food assistance.
